title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 August 2013 - XWiki
content:
<Mariah> has joined #xwiki  
00:22 <polx> has quit  
00:43 <Mariah> has quit  
05:29 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
07:24 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:35 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:27 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <evalica> has quit  
09:05 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:50 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
12:15 <vmassol> sburjan: sometihng to read: http://blog.scoutapp.com/articles/2013/08/28/docker-git-for-deployment  
14:06 <irctc806> has joined #xwiki  
14:07 <irctc806> Hi all, is it possible to have multiple AuthServices defined in xwiki.cfg or another way to set up a custom login page, with custom redirects and error pages (the working login must stay as it is)  
14:13 <camil7> this sounds like a complicated requirement  
14:13 <camil7> does the custom login page more/less fields than the one which is there now?  
14:15 <tmortagne> irctc806: you can't define several AuthServices in xwiki.cfg but you can write a custom auth service that will test several AuthServices behind the scene  
14:16 <tmortagne> as for the login page it's a bit more complex since the authservice API only takes login and pass officially but you can hack something to pass other informations to your service using URL parameters, HTTP headers, etc  
14:17 <irctc806> thanks for the suggestions  
14:17 <irctc806> the fields are the same  
14:17 <tmortagne> ok then it should be easy if it's just graphical stuff, just need to override it I think  
14:18 <irctc806> okay I'll see and come back with congrete questions, thank you  
14:18 <tmortagne> you’re welcome  
14:35 <camil7> has quit  
14:37 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:38 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
14:40 <polx> has quit  
14:40 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
14:43 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:44 <camil7> Denis G has finished a pull request to fix XWIKI-9403  at  https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/142  
14:44 <camil7> maybe this is something for todays BFD ?  
14:45 <vmassol> oh...  
14:45 <vmassol> forgot about BFD  
14:45 <vmassol> crap  
14:45 <camil7> ah, ok  
14:45 <vmassol> we have 2 options: I prepare the jira/mail and we start working on BFD now or we postpone it to tomorrow  
14:45 <camil7> me too ... wanted to send a pull request for XWIKI-9400 and are now quite pressed to manage it ...  
14:45 <vmassol> wdyt?  
14:46 <vmassol> tmortagne, gdelhumeau, evalica, sdumitriu?  
14:46 <vmassol> IMO it's a bit too late for today  
14:46 <vmassol> we won't achieve much  
14:46 <gdelhumeau> gdelhumeau: I try to finish my work for 5.2m2  
14:46 <gdelhumeau> I mean vmassol ^^  
14:47 <vmassol> we all do, we all do :)  
14:47 <evalica> today is late  
14:47 <vmassol> but BFD is part of our work for 5.2  
14:47 <vmassol> tomorrow ok?  
14:48 <tmortagne> vmassol: started to work on BFD actually  
14:50 <camil7> Denis G is around here today till 1700 CEST, but  tomorrow only till 1400 CEST  
14:53 <vmassol> tmortagne: so what do you recommend?  
14:53 <vmassol> we do 2 days BFD and devs decide to participate either today or tomorrow?  
14:54 <tmortagne> vmassol: just saying, I doubt I will work on BFD tomorrow but I don't really care if people want to work on it tomorrow  
14:55 <vmassol> ok so I'll annonce the BFD for tomorrow but I'll take today into account for the results  
14:55 <vmassol> ok for you tmortagne?  
14:55 <tmortagne> I'm ok for the 2 days thing but it's sound a bit fuzzy for something that is supposed to be a standard event  
14:55 <tmortagne> s/it's/it/  
14:56 <vmassol> well if we keep today then we'll have 1-2 bug fixes (yours) which isn't enough  
14:58 <vmassol> and we already skipped the BFD for the 15th of Aug  
14:59 <msmeria> has quit  
15:04 <vmassol> sending mail  
15:22 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
15:22 <sdumitriu> has quit  
15:23 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
15:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: have you tried to upgrade to lucene 4.4 already? Elasticsearch requires lucene 4.4 and we're using 4.0 ATM  
15:44 <vmassol> (elasticsearch client java api)  
15:45 <tmortagne> I did not touched lucene, just looked at solr and solr upgrade is blocked by restlet  
15:45 <vmassol> arg  
15:46 <gdelhumeau> Hi  
15:46 <tmortagne> if lucene gyys did not broke any API I guess you can upgrade it without upgrading solr  
15:46 <tmortagne> guys  
15:46 <vmassol> it doesn't work  
15:46 <vmassol> I get exceptions at startup  
15:46 <tmortagne> ok  
15:47 <gdelhumeau> Do you think WikiManager#createNeWiki() (that creates a new subwiki) should check if the user has the correct right to do it?  
15:47 <gdelhumeau> To me, it's part of the responsibility of that class.  
15:47 <vmassol> btw not sure why ES client requires lucene, need to check that more  
15:47 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: it's done in WikiManagerPluginApi  
15:48 <tmortagne> and checking right is generally responsibility of the script service (in this case it's a plugin api but it's the same idea) and not the actual component  
15:48 <gdelhumeau> ok thx  
15:50 <vmassol> indeed rights should only be checked at boundaries to avoid overhead. Once you're inside you have all rights.  
15:58 <polx> has quit  
16:04 <Mariah> has joined #xwiki  
17:06 <sburjan> has quit  
17:34 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:47 <gdelhumeau> Do you think we can create the workspace-template at the first lounch of xwiki ?  
17:47 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: we used to but people complained  
17:47 <gdelhumeau> what was their complaints?  
17:47 <tmortagne> (admins complains)  
17:48 <Mariah> hello....  
17:48 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: things like "my wiki do things I don't control, it's not the way I create wiki, I don't need this template since I'm creating custom wikis, ..."  
17:49 <Mariah> im trying to install iframe macro extension but when i try to install it, i cant find the extension into the pannel administration  
17:49 <Mariah> how can install it?  
17:51 <camil7> is it about this macro:  http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Iframe+Macro  
17:52 <Mariah>  yes  
17:52 <Mariah> im triying to find the extension  
17:52 <Mariah> into pannel administration  
17:52 <camil7> it is not extension, it seems  
17:52 <Mariah> its embedded?  
17:53 <camil7> not everything on extensions.xwiki.org is installable via Extension manager, only those with a big green "Installable with the Extension Manager"  
17:54 <Slashman> has quit  
17:54 <camil7> ithe iframe is a "snippet" that you can "install" by copy & paste the text in the "Installation" section, I think  
17:55 <Mariah> excellent  
17:55 <Mariah> thnx :) camil7  
17:57 <camil7> hm, seems macros have changed a bit since the time this macro has been written  
17:58 <camil7> well, unless it should be used inside of a {{velocity}} macro anyway - in that case you just copy & paste it into that {{velocity}} block  
17:58 <tmortagne> camil7: yes  
17:58 <tmortagne> the installation instruction has been written for xwiki/1.0 syntax I think  
17:58 <tmortagne> (which parse velocity by default)  
17:59 <camil7> if one wants to have it in the wysiwyg editor this needs a bit more clicking around  
17:59 <tmortagne> it should be rewriten as wiki macro ideally I think  
17:59 <tmortagne> and provided as XAR extension  
18:00 <camil7> ah, yes, for xwiki/1.0 not even the {{velocity}} markers would be necessary  ... but that is not recommended, of course  
18:01 <camil7> hm, how would one add l10n files for the xar ?  creating the macro page itself seems to be relatively easy ... (I hope, it does not work yet)  
18:02 <tmortagne> camil7: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Localization+Module#HRegisterawikitranslation  
18:02 <camil7> tmortagne: thanks!  
18:10 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
18:28 <evalica> has quit  
18:39 <polx> has quit  
18:44 <camil7>  Mariah: it is still not installable via extension manager, and UI is still englidh, despite of  tmortagne's pointer ... I struggled with stupid erros of mine  
18:45 <camil7> for now the \*.xar attachment should be good enough for a test, will continue tomorrow  
18:47 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:51 <camil7> has quit  
19:44 <gdelhumeau> has quit

22:24 <polx> has quit  
22:25 <polx> has joined #xwiki

22:42 <abusenius> has quit  
22:50 <polx> has quit  
22:54 <polx> has joined #xwiki
